name: Stone v1.0
description: Stone's roadmap follows a dependency-driven path from foundation to polish. Phase 1 establishes the app architecture and core time tracking with accurate timer behavior across sleep/wake cycles. Phase 2 builds project organization features (folders, tags, colors) on the stable foundation. Phase 3 adds reporting and visualization once time data exists. Phase 4 integrates CloudKit sync after the data model is proven stable. Phase 5 adds final polish and convenience features.

userStories.title: Phase 1: Foundation + Core Tracking
userStories.description: User can track time for projects with accurate timer that persists across sleep/wake cycles and app restarts.
acceptanceCriteria: User can start a timer for a project from menu bar with one click
User can see elapsed time updating in menu bar while timer runs
User can stop timer and time entry is saved permanently
Timer automatically pauses when Mac sleeps and resumes on wake without drift
User can switch between projects and previous timer auto-stops
User can manually add time entries for retroactive logging
User can edit existing time entries
User is prompted after idle periods with option to keep or discard idle time
All time data persists across app restarts

userStories.title: Phase 2: Project Organization
userStories.description: User can organize projects into folders with tags and colors for easy visual identification and filtering.
acceptanceCriteria: User can create new projects with names and colors
User can edit project names inline
User can delete projects with confirmation dialog
User can organize projects into folders (hierarchical structure)
User can create, edit, and delete folders
User can add multiple tags to projects
User can filter project list by tag
User can reorder projects within folders via drag-and-drop
User can open Preferences window to manage projects

userStories.title: Phase 3: Reporting
userStories.description: User can view time summaries, visualize time distribution, and export data for external use.
acceptanceCriteria: User can view daily time summary showing hours per project
User can view weekly and monthly time summaries
User can see searchable list of all time entries
User can view pie chart of time distribution by project
User can view bar chart of time by day/week
User can export time data to CSV format
User can open Reports window from menu bar

userStories.title: Phase 4: CloudKit Sync
userStories.description: User's data syncs automatically across all their Macs via iCloud with visible sync status.
acceptanceCriteria: Time entries and projects sync automatically to iCloud
User can see sync status indicator showing sync progress/errors
Changes on one Mac appear on other Macs within minutes
Conflicts from concurrent edits are resolved automatically without data loss
User sees warning before iCloud account changes that might affect data

userStories.title: Phase 5: Polish
userStories.description: App feels native and polished with convenience features like launch at login.
acceptanceCriteria: User can enable "Launch at Login" in preferences
App automatically launches at login when enabled
Menu bar icon renders correctly in both light and dark mode
No memory leaks detected via Instruments profiling
